content: crocheted cat bed supply list bernat blanket big 2 skeins stitch markers if desired stitches chain chain st stitch slip_stitch slip_stitch single_crochet single_crochet blo back loops only notes -this pattern doesn t use any hooks i made these beds using my hands to make the loops if you prefer you can use a large sized hook bernat recommends size 50/25mm with this yarn but i haven t ever used one so i can t guarantee the final size -you will use one skein for the base of the bed and one for the walls of the bed -i prefer to work the entire base using back loops only and then switching to regular crocheting for the walls to create a petal-like design on the bottom but feel free to work the whole thing using normal stitches -depending on your gauge you may come up slightly short or slightly over on the final round of the base i find that once the walls are formed you don t really notice an absence of four or five stitches -i recommend lessening your gauge when making the base to prevent a cone forming and to make the base as large as possible and tightening your gauge when you make the walls the tighter your gauge is when making the walls of your bed the taller/sturdier the walls will be base of bed base chain 3 join with slip_stitch to first chain make a circle r1 single_crochet 6 st into the circle 6 r2 2sc blo into all 6 st do not join 12 r3 single_crochet blo into next st 2sc blo into second st repeat 5 times 18 r4 single_crochet blo into next 2st 2 single_crochet blo into next st repeat 5 times 24 r5 single_crochet blo into next 3st single_crochet blo into next st repeat 5 times 30 r6 single_crochet blo into next 4st single_crochet blo into next st repeat 5 times 36 r7 single_crochet blo into next 5 st single_crochet blo into next st repeat 5 times bind off 42 * if your gauge is too loose you may be short a few stitches when your skein runs out if you are short 7 stitches or less it tends to be unnoticeable in the final product wall of bed r1-7 ish join the next skein to the bottom of the bed single_crochet into each st in continuous rounds until you run out of yarn or are satisfied with the wall s height work continuously on each round do not join with a slip_stitch bind off
